alert.note: Alert for City of Emporia; Greensville; Southampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 7:49PM EST until January 13 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Virginia... Meherrin River At Emporia affecting Southampton, City of Emporia and Greensville Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River Near Stony Creek affecting Sussex County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Meherrin River at Emporia. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flood waters infiltrate sewer system. The parking lot next to the ball fields in EGRA Park begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 23.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM EST Friday was 23.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 7.4 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.3 feet on 03/23/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EST.
